text.p: The following are the main stories from Monday morning's Slovenian newspapers:
- Slovenian President Milan Kucan visited Pope John Paul on Saturday. He was accompanied by some 3,500 pilgrims on his trip to Rome.
- Slovenian ski-jumper Primoz Peterka, 18, won a giant hill ski jumping event over the weekend in the Czech town of Harrachov, putting him in the first place of the overall World Cup standings.

- Investment activity fell to 23.8 billion tolars ($170 million) in October, down 12 percent from the previous month, the Slovenia's payment agency said. In the first nine months of the year, investment activity totalled 236 billion tolars.
- Slovenian construction companies built 390 new appartments during the first nine months over the year, 13 less than in the same period of last year.
- Prime Minister Janez Drnovsek attended a European Union summit in Dublin on Saturday. Drnovsek said Slovenia could qualify for membership in Europe's planned monetary union soon.
- The number of tourists' overnight stays in Slovenia fell two percent to 5.2 million in the first ten months of the year, the country's Chamber of Economy said.
